subject: Technology
title: Unimate: The First Industrial Robot
description: A fast breakdown of Unimate: The First Industrial Robot for builders.

hook.text: In 1961, a giant mechanical arm started working at a General Motors factory. It never took a break.

buildup.text: Unimate was the first industrial robot. It lifted hot metal parts from a die-casting machine all day, every day.

discovery.text: The job was dangerous for humans. Burns and injuries were common. Unimate felt no pain and made no complaints.

twist.text: Unimate's inventor George Devol couldn't find investors for years. Everyone thought factory robots were science fiction.

climax.text: Today, over three million industrial robots work in factories worldwide, all descendants of Unimate.

punchline.text: The first robot worker was hired because the job was too dangerous for people.

quiz.question: What task did Unimate perform?
options: Lifting hot metal parts from a die-casting machine
